com.jme3.scene.plugins.blender.textures

Class ImageUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jme3.scene.plugins.blender.textures.ImageUtils

  • public final class ImageUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    This utility class has the methods that deal with images.
    Author:
    Marcin Roguski (Kaelthas)

      ImageUtils()

      The method sets a color for the given pixel by merging the two given colors.
      static com.jme3.texture.Image convertToGrayscaleTexture(com.jme3.texture.Image source)

      This method converts the given texture into normal-map texture.

      This method merges two given images.

    • Method Detail

      • createEmptyImage

        public static com.jme3.texture.Image createEmptyImage(com.jme3.texture.Image.Format format,
                                                      int width,
                                                      int height,
                                                      int depth)
        Creates an image of the given size and depth.
        Parameters:
        format - the image format
        width - the image width
        height - the image height
        depth - the image depth
        Returns:
        the new image instance

      • color

        public static TexturePixel color(TexturePixel pixel,
                                 com.jme3.math.ColorRGBA lowIntensityColor,
                                 com.jme3.math.ColorRGBA highIntensityColor)
        The method sets a color for the given pixel by merging the two given colors. The lowIntensityColor will be most visible when the pixel has low intensity. The highIntensityColor will be most visible when the pixel has high intensity.
        Parameters:
        pixel - the pixel that will have the colors altered
        lowIntensityColor - the low intensity color
        highIntensityColor - the high intensity color
        Returns:
        the altered pixel (the same instance)

      • merge

        public static void merge(com.jme3.texture.Image targetImage,
                         com.jme3.texture.Image sourceImage)
        This method merges two given images. The result is stored in the 'target' image.
        Parameters:
        targetImage - the target image
        sourceImage - the source image

      • mix

        public static void mix(com.jme3.texture.Image targetImage,
                       com.jme3.texture.Image sourceImage)
        This method merges two given images. The result is stored in the 'target' image.
        Parameters:
        targetImage - the target image
        sourceImage - the source image

      • resizeTo

        public static com.jme3.texture.Image resizeTo(com.jme3.texture.Image source,
                                              int width,
                                              int height)
        Resizes the image to the given width and height.
        Parameters:
        source - the source image (this remains untouched, the new image instance is created)
        width - the target image width
        height - the target image height
        Returns:
        the resized image

      • convertToNormalMapTexture

        public static com.jme3.texture.Image convertToNormalMapTexture(com.jme3.texture.Image source,
                                                               float strengthFactor)
        This method converts the given texture into normal-map texture.
        Parameters:
        source - the source texture
        strengthFactor - the normal strength factor
        Returns:
        normal-map texture

      • convertToGrayscaleTexture

        public static com.jme3.texture.Image convertToGrayscaleTexture(com.jme3.texture.Image source)
        This method converts the given texture into black and whit (grayscale) texture.
        Parameters:
        source - the source texture
        Returns:
        grayscale texture

      • decompress

        public static com.jme3.texture.Image decompress(com.jme3.texture.Image image)
        This method decompresses the given image. If the given image is already decompressed nothing happens and it is simply returned.
        Parameters:
        image - the image to decompress
        Returns:
        the decompressed image
